bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Subpoena
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Unites States of America Territory of Washington 3rd Judicial District } ss

The President of the United States of America to Chareles Finn Thomas Delaney. Indian Billy and Indian Annie. You are back, commander to be and applicant within expense or delay before James G Sworn United States Commisioner for the 3rd Judicial District WT at his office in Port Townsend at this O'Clock PM this day this and there to testidy and the brought to stay in a certain examination pending before said commision the United States. Plaintiff and Leonard Martin defendants, on the part of said Plaintiff there of said not
In witness whereof I hereto set my hands at my office in said District this fifth day of May AD 1885
James G Swan US Commisions 3rd District WT

I reasured the within this 1st day of May AD 1885 and proceeded forthwith and subpena Charles Finn. Thomas Belaney, Humpback Billey and Annie his wife by reading the same to these in person this 1st day of May AB 1885
J.W.George US Marshall By J.G.Clinger Deputy
US Commisonary Court James G Swan Commision United States vs Leonard Martin} NO 806
Subpoena Witneses Charles Finn Thomas Delaney Indian Bilky " Annie Returned & filed May 1st 1885
Marshals fees Subponing 4 Witneses at 50 cort each $ 2.00
